text: Sergey Alexeyevich Vakhrukov (, born 20 June 1958 in Rybinsk) is a Russian politician, and is a former Governor of Yaroslavl Oblast.KHL delays games, but season will go on for Lokomotiv | Posted Sports | National Post On 25 December 2007, Vakhrukov was appointed to the position of Governor by Russian President Vladimir Putin. His tenure ended on 25 August 2012, and Sergey Yastrubov succeeded him beginning 28 August 2012. Yastrubov's term of governorship ended on 28 July 2016, and he was followed by Dmitry Mironov who entered office on the same day. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:Living people Category:Governors of Yaroslavl Oblast Category:People from Rybinsk Category:United Russia politicians Category:21st-century Russian politicians Category:Russian State University for the Humanities alumni
title: Sergey Vakhrukov
